eea.engine.entity
Class StateBasedEntityManager

java.lang.Object
  eea.engine.entity.StateBasedEntityManager

public class StateBasedEntityManager
extends java.lang.Object

The StateBasedEntityManager is responsible for updating entities based on the current state of the game, as well as detecting collisions based on the current game state. Note that the programmer can not create a new instance of this object. Instead, retrieve the current instance using the static method getInstance().

Version:
1.0
Author:
Alexander Jandousek, Timo Bähr

colides

@Deprecated
public Entity colides(int gameState,
                                 Entity entity)
Deprecated. 

This method has been deprecated and is only provided for backward compatibility. Use collides(int, Entity) instead.

Parameters:
gameState - the target state of the game to examine
entity - the entity to check for a possible collision
Returns:
true if the current entity has collided with the parameter
See Also:
collides(int, Entity)

collides

public Entity collides(int gameState,
                       Entity entity)
determines the first entity with which the entity passed in currently collides in the given gameState.

Parameters:
gameState - the target state of the game to examine
entity - the entity to check for a possible collision, e.g., the player figure or a bullet
Returns:
true if "entity" has collided with an entity in state "gameState". Note that objects with the same ID can never "collide".

getEntitiesByState

public java.util.List<Entity> getEntitiesByState(int stateID)
returns a list of all entities with ID stateID

Parameters:
stateID - the ID for which all associated entities are requested
Returns:
a list of all entities (may be null) with the given ID

getEntity

public Entity getEntity(int state,
                        java.lang.String name)
returns the first entity with the given name for the selected state, if such an entity exists. Otherwise, returns null.

Parameters:
state - the state to be examined for the entity
name - the name (ID) of the entity to look for
Returns:
the first entity in state state that has the ID name, or null if there is no such element

hasEntity

public boolean hasEntity(int state,
                         java.lang.String prefix)
check if there is at least one entity in state state with a name that starts with prefix

Parameters:
state - the state to examine
prefix - the prefix with which a given entity must start
Returns:
true if there is at least one entity with the chosen ID prefix in the selected state

removeEntity

public void removeEntity(int state,
                         Entity entity)
removes the concrete entity from the selected state

Parameters:
state - the chosen state
entity - the entity to remove from the state

renderEntities

public void renderEntities(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc,
                           org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame sb,
                           org.newdawn.slick.Graphics graphicsContext)
causes all entities in the current game state to render themselves Invokes the Entity.render(GameContainer, StateBasedGame, Graphics) method on all entities in the current game state

Parameters:
gc - the GameContainer object that handles the game loop, recording of the frame rate, and managing the input system
sb - the StateBasedGame that isolates different stages of the game (e.g., menu, ingame, highscores etc.) into different states so they can be easily managed and maintained. This is queried for the current state ID using StateBasedGame.getCurrentStateID() .
graphicsContext - the graphics context necessary for painting ("rendering") the component on the game container display

setEntityListByState

public void setEntityListByState(int stateID,
                                 java.util.List<Entity> targetEntities)
assigns all targetEntities to the state associated with stateID

Parameters:
stateID - the ID of a state
targetEntities - the list of entities to be placed in the state referenced by stateID

updateEntities

public void updateEntities(org.newdawn.slick.GameContainer gc,
                           org.newdawn.slick.state.StateBasedGame sb,
                           int delta)
updates all entities in the current game state Invokes the Entity.update(GameContainer, StateBasedGame, int) method on all entities in the current game state

Parameters:
gc - the GameContainer object that handles the game loop, recording of the frame rate, and managing the input system
sb - the StateBasedGame that isolates different stages of the game (e.g., menu, ingame, highscores etc.) into different states so they can be easily managed and maintained. This is queried for the current state ID using StateBasedGame.getCurrentStateID() .
delta - the time passed in nanoseconds (ns) since the start of the event, used to interpolate the current target position
